title: Ticket #6242: Debian jessie upstream package named htcondor
description:
Debian has renamed its OS-provided package to htcondor. This means that adding the UW-managed repo and running "apt-get install condor" runs into conflicts and that "apt-get upgrade" doesn't see a reason to upgrade the package.

One solution is for the UW-managed package to set "Provides: htcondor" in its package settings. Alternative you could rename your package and set "Provides: condor" for backwards compatibility. Either option allows "apt-get install condor" to behave as it currently does.
creator: tpdownes
